summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 25, 2019, concerning a report of Jeffrey Epstein being sighted on the Palm Beach bike path with a young girl. The correspondence involves a concerned citizen communicating with a Deputy Assistant Attorney General in the DOJ's Criminal Division, raising questions about law enforcement response to a registered sex offender in areas where children congregate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered sex offender, subject of sighting report
persons.context: Reported to have been sighted several times riding a bicycle on the Palm Beach bike path accompanied by a very young girl in late 2018 and early 2019.

persons.name: Mr. [Redacted]
persons.role: Former Palm Beach Chief of Police
persons.context: Led the original Epstein investigation in 2005; was informed by the email author of an earlier sighting in December 2018. Provided information about cameras on the bike path and policies regarding registered offenders.

persons.name: Ms. [Redacted]
persons.role: Deputy Assistant Attorney General, Criminal Division, U.S. Department of Justice
persons.context: The point of contact for the email author regarding information about Jeffrey Epstein; coordinates communication about the reported sightings.

connections.description: Ms. [Redacted], a DOJ official, is the point person receiving and evaluating information about Epstein's reported activities in 2019.
Mr. [Redacted], former PB Police Chief, led the original 2005 investigation into Epstein and was informed of a 2018 sighting.

events.title: Original Epstein investigation in Palm Beach
events.description: The initial investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities, led by Mr. [Redacted], the former Palm Beach Chief of Police.

events.title: Reported Epstein sighting on Palm Beach bike path
events.description: An earlier sighting of Jeffrey Epstein on the Palm Beach bike path, which was reported to the former Police Chief.

events.title: Extended date for Epstein sighting information
events.description: The email author extends the timeframe of their reported information to include February 21, 2019.

events.title: Email correspondence regarding Epstein sightings
events.description: Series of emails discussing reported sightings of Epstein with a young girl on the Palm Beach bike path and questions about law enforcement response.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein, a level 3 registered sex offender, was reportedly sighted several times in late 2018 and early 2019 riding a bicycle on the Palm Beach bike path accompanied by a very young Caucasian brunette girl with a ponytail, estimated to be not older than 18.
The email author had previously reported a December 2018 sighting to Mr. [Redacted], the former Palm Beach Chief of Police who led the original 2005 Epstein investigation.

Mr. [Redacted] indicated there are cameras on the PB bike path, registered offenders are not allowed on the path, and a sighting could make Epstein's incident a police matter, but video tapes are reviewed every 3 months and then erased.
The Palm Beach police department, when contacted the prior week, had no knowledge of the reported incident involving Epstein and the young girl.

The correspondence raises legal questions about why a registered offender would be allowed in areas where children congregate and whether a sighting in such an area warrants police investigation or arrest.
